step1.sentence: I told a white lie and said I loved her cooking, even though the soup was way too salty.

step2.story: My coworker showed me a painting she'd spent weeks on and asked what I thought. It wasn't great, but she looked so proud. I told a white lie and said it was beautiful, because sometimes kindness matters more than honesty.

step3.story: Last Friday, my best friend invited me to her apartment to try a new recipe she'd been perfecting. She served me a plate of homemade pasta with a hopeful smile. The truth was, it was overcooked and bland, but I could see how much effort she had put in. So I told a white lie and said it was one of the best meals I'd ever had. Her face lit up instantly, and she started planning a dinner party to cook it for more friends. Sometimes a small white lie can protect someone's feelings and encourage them to keep pursuing what they love.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '하얀 거짓말'로, 악의 없는 거짓말을 뜻합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 상대방의 기분을 배려하거나 불필요한 갈등을 피하기 위해 하는 무해한 거짓말을 말합니다. 진실을 말하면 상대가 상처받을 상황에서 자주 사용됩니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 서양 문화에서 '흰색(white)'은 순수함과 무해함을 상징합니다. 이 표현은 18세기부터 사용되었으며, 악의적인 거짓말(black lie)과 대비되는 개념으로 자리 잡았습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 부정적인 뉘앙스가 거의 없으며, 오히려 배려심 있는 행동으로 여겨지는 경우가 많습니다. 다만 남용하면 신뢰를 잃을 수 있다는 맥락에서도 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She told a white lie to avoid hurting his feelings.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 그의 기분을 상하게 하지 않으려고 선의의 거짓말을 했다.
